name: Backline Raider
description: Attacks and spells go off faster.
lore: "We move on horseback but we strike on foot. They should never hear us coming, for if they do we face certain death. By the time they realize they are getting flanked, we should already be back to our mounts and going. I don't want anyone playing hero on this squad." Triss, The Flying Dragoon _________________________________________________________ Intelligence gathering is the key to successful warfare. Such a pretty sentence is a staple taught in Republican military academies, yet those few words have very real implications on the field. There is an ever growing need for discrete and fast soldiers able to track opposing forces' positions, work behind enemy lines or even infiltrate them for sabotage. They are the backbone that allows Inquisitors to make sound strategic decisions. One of them made a name for herself among Republican troops: The Flying Dragoon, a scout from a squad of light cavalry dedicated to harassing the enemy's supply chain. Her reputation states that she is so effective that her sabotages alone are enough to shatter opposing troops' morale.

name: Covert Operative
description: More likely to avoid taking damage after being hit.
lore: "If you want to get a feel of the enemy, join him. Standing armies or evil cults, it matters not. You have to think and move like one of them if you want to survive. The hardest part still, will always be to break character and slip out for a report." Triss, The Flying Dragoon _________________________________________________________ Intelligence gathering is the key to successful warfare. Such a pretty sentence is a staple taught in Republican military academies, yet those few words have very real implications on the field. There is an ever growing need for discrete and fast soldiers able to track opposing forces' positions, work behind enemy lines or even infiltrate them for sabotage. They are the backbone that allows Inquisitors to make sound strategic decisions. One of them made a name for herself among Republican troops: The Flying Dragoon, a scout from a squad of light cavalry dedicated to harassing the enemy's supply chain. Her reputation states that she is so effective that her sabotages alone are enough to shatter opposing troops' morale.

modifiers.description: +50% Dodge Chance Score after taking a hit

name: Pinch Runner
description: Gain additional stamina points to use dodge rolls at low health. This ability has a cooldown.
lore: "Many generals say that fear is the enemy. They sit comfortably, directing units miles away from the bloodshed. When you are discovered in enemy territory and you have to run for your life, fear may be the only thing that keeps you alive." Triss, The Flying Dragoon _________________________________________________________ Intelligence gathering is the key to successful warfare. Such a pretty sentence is a staple taught in Republican military academies, yet those few words have very real implications on the field. There is an ever growing need for discrete and fast soldiers able to track opposing forces' positions, work behind enemy lines or even infiltrate them for sabotage. They are the backbone that allows Inquisitors to make sound strategic decisions. One of them made a name for herself among Republican troops: The Flying Dragoon, a scout from a squad of light cavalry dedicated to harassing the enemy's supply chain. Her reputation states that she is so effective that her sabotages alone are enough to shatter opposing troops' morale.

modifiers.description: Gain +3.0 Stamina Point(s) when at ? of Max Health or lower

name: The Wild Card
description: Attacks and spells are more likely to be critical hits.
lore: "Chop! Chop! It's time for some killing boys! Show me what your guts are made of!" Almarik, Shock Infantryman _________________________________________________________ Most armies create their own mythos, populated with larger-than-life heroes that give troops examples to look-up to. Detractors often dismiss them as artificial myths created to fuel the war propaganda that surrounds them. Yet, the one known as "Soldier Almarik" is very real. Despite his prowess, he made his name by willingly keeping the lowest rank in the Purifiers' army. Burdening himself with anything other than the art of killing would not fit his style. His home is the battlefield.

name: Second Wind
description: When below a certain threshold of health, gain a burst of Health Regen. This ability has a cooldown.
lore: "Purifiers protect mankind from the supernatural evils of the world... tsk, bunch of pompous twats! I merely play along that rubbish as long as they let me slaugther stuff for them!" Almarik, Shock Infantryman _________________________________________________________ Most armies create their own mythos, populated with larger-than-life heroes that give troops examples to look-up to. Detractors often dismiss them as artificial myths created to fuel the war propaganda that surrounds them. Yet, the one known as "Soldier Almarik" is very real. Despite his prowess, he made his name by willingly keeping the lowest rank in the Purifiers' army. Burdening himself with anything other than the art of killing would not fit his style. His home is the battlefield.

modifiers.description: When under +500% of Max Health, gain a burst of Health Regeneration

name: The Heat of Battle
description: Taking damage gives you more rage.
lore: "If you take a hit, you hit 'em back twice. One to take 'em out, and the other to fuck up their corpse." Almarik, Shock Infantryman _________________________________________________________ Most armies create their own mythos, populated with larger-than-life heroes that give troops examples to look-up to. Detractors often dismiss them as artificial myths created to fuel the war propaganda that surrounds them. Yet, the one known as "Soldier Almarik" is very real. Despite his prowess, he made his name by willingly keeping the lowest rank in the Purifiers' army. Burdening himself with anything other than the art of killing would not fit his style. His home is the battlefield.

name: Attrition Strategist
description: Every hit is more likely to inflict an ailment on its target.
lore: "Patience, Inquisitor. Stay your hand. Our foes are cornered and not going anywhere. Our best move might be not to move at all... let them slowly wither. Force them into a desperate charge to break our lines. Only then, shall they be crushed." Jeremiah, Battle Counselor of the 4th Purifier Legion _________________________________________________________ One needs foresight, strategy and knowledge to efficiently lead a battalion. That's why Inquisitors and Justicars of the Republic surround themselves with specialists that know the terrain, culture and anatomy of their enemies. For the Purifiers, those enemies belong to the supernatural which forces their scholars to study witchcraft even though they are strictly forbidden from ever practicing it. A thin line that drove many to madness or even to the stake. Yet, Counselor Jeremiah successfully mastered those forbidden arts in secrecy, using them to become one of the best battle masterminds in history. Of course he has declined all opportunities of advancement, being more than happy to stay in the shadow of ambitious Inquisitors while he delves deeper into forbidden knowledge.

name: Purifier's Will
description: When your Force Shield is full, your damage taken is reduced.
lore: "If they knew of my powers, I would be branded a traitor. Purifiers do not see the world in shades of grey: anything magical is considered witchcraft and consorting with demons. Sometimes I wish I could teach them of my findings, bring the republic to new heights of power by making the occult an ally rather than a foe. Yet, they are far from ready." Jeremiah, Battle Counselor of the 4th Purifier Legion _________________________________________________________ One needs foresight, strategy and knowledge to efficiently lead a battalion. That's why Inquisitors and Justicars of the Republic surround themselves with specialists that know the terrain, culture and anatomy of their enemies. For the Purifiers, those enemies belong to the supernatural which forces their scholars to study witchcraft even though they are strictly forbidden from ever practicing it. A thin line that drove many to madness or even to the stake. Yet, Counselor Jeremiah successfully mastered those forbidden arts in secrecy, using them to become one of the best battle masterminds in history. Of course he has declined all opportunities of advancement, being more than happy to stay in the shadow of ambitious Inquisitors while he delves deeper into forbidden knowledge.

modifiers.description: +30.0% Damage Reduction when Force Shield is full
+15.0 Range for picking up Health Globes

name: Thirst for Knowledge
description: Health globes now both heal your health and recharge your force shield.
lore: "Soldiers are told to be willing to lay down their lives in the Republic. Not on my watch. A Purifier's life must be protected, so that they may uncover the cultists' mysteries. The more we know, the stronger we become." Jeremiah, Battle Counselor of the 4th Purifier Legion _________________________________________________________ One needs foresight, strategy and knowledge to efficiently lead a battalion. That's why Inquisitors and Justicars of the Republic surround themselves with specialists that know the terrain, culture and anatomy of their enemies. Of course he has declined all opportunities of advancement, being more than happy to stay in the shadow of ambitious Inquisitors while he delves deeper into forbidden knowledge.

modifiers.description: +25.0% Force Shield Recharge from Health Globes

name: Persistence Hunting
description: Enemies who have impairment movement (slowed, in stasis, stunned or frozen) take increased damage.
lore: "Tracking an animal is like getting to know them. Beyond the curled teeth and barbed tail, you see where they eat, where they sleep, where they hunt. Pursuing them until they collapse, you finally take the life you know so well." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. Once a year, the Departed, a troop made of brave rangers, are sent out to map these frontier lands. Few return, and those that do often come back with mental diseases festering in their mind. All know that they should never stay longer than a night out there... except for "Blue", a lone wolf which learned how to survive on his own for weeks. To this day, Blue hasn't shared his secret nor the wonders that he discovered out there.

modifiers.description: +25.0% Damage to enemies with Impaired Movement
+25% Stasis Chance Score on Aether Damage
+20% Stun Chance Score on Physical Damage
+20% Freeze Chance Score on Frost Damage
+20% All Projectiles Critical Hit Chance Score
+20% All Projectiles Critical Hit Chance Score

name: Come What May
description: Projectiles that hit an enemy at close range pierce them and can deal damage to other enemies behind them.
lore: "I've seen so many Departed die from the treachery of these lands. Warning them of the horrors they will face does not change their fate... you have to be there. You have to see for yourself. If you survive them once, you might survive them twice and eventually you might call yourself prepared for anything." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. Once a year, the Departed, a troop made of brave rangers, are sent out to map these frontier lands. Few return, and those that do often come back with mental diseases festering in their mind. All know that they should never stay longer than a night out there... except for "Blue", a lone wolf which learned how to survive on his own for weeks. To this day, Blue hasn't shared his secret nor the wonders that he discovered out there.

name: Archion's Teachings
description: Attacks and spells that launch projectiles now launch an additional projectile. The damage of each projectile is reduced.
lore: "Whenever I'm home, younglings ask me what should they do to be like me... I simply tell them to listen to their militia instructor, after all, we have the best ranged warfare of the world. But the truth is: I don't want them to follow my path. These lands are best untouched, left alone. I just go there to find solace, not to conquer them." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. To this day, Blue hasn't shared his secret nor the wonders that he discovered out there.

modifiers.description: +1 Projectile(s) to all Projectile Skills (Attacks and Spells)
+10% All Projectiles Critical Hit Chance Score

name: Meditative Focus
description: Deal increased damage when far away from enemies.
lore: "Killing another living creature should never be done lightly. When possible, I take my time with each arrow, recognizing their deadly potential. If that potential is aligned with my intent, I can be certain that it will land true." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. modifiers.description: +25.0% Damage when at least +6.0m away from all enemies
+10.0% Damage when at least +0.0m away from all enemies
+0.0% Damage when at least -2.0m away from all enemies

name: Safe From Afar
description: The further away an enemy is, the more damage they take from projectiles up to a limit.
lore: "First rule of survival: Curiosity kills. If something comes your way and you are unsure of its intentions, shoot or run, but don't stand there wondering." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. Once a year, the Departed, a troop made of brave rangers, are sent out to map these frontier lands. Few return, and those that do often come back with mental diseases festering in their mind. All know that they should never stay longer than a night out there... except for "Blue", a lone wolf which learned how to survive on his own for weeks. To this day, Blue hasn't shared his secret nor the wonders that he discovered out there.

modifiers.description: +175.0% All Projectiles Damage scaling with Distance at 8.0 ~ 15.0 m

name: Bestial Frenzy
description: Increased damage for each enemy within melee range.
lore: "Mortal danger brings out the best in a warrior. Being surrounded by an overwhelming number of enemies will turn you into a creature of war, an unstoppable being of death. If you survive that is." Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. But these nightmarish depictions of violence caught up with fiction when the Ravagers of the Blood Tear stormed the lands of Varg. A terrifying warrior depicted as a whirlwind of iron and gore has risen as their new warlord. In his aura they seem to have reached new depths of savagery: cannibalism, blood rituals, dismemberments... the madness knows no bounds.

modifiers.description: +20.0% Damage for each nearby enemy within +4.0%m range
+5.0% Damage for each nearby enemy within +1.0%m range
+0.0% Damage for each nearby enemy within +0.0%m range
+30.0% Fire Damage converted into Physical Damage
+30.0% Frost Damage converted into Physical Damage
+30.0% Lightning Damage converted into Physical Damage
+30.0% Aether Damage converted into Physical Damage
+30.0% Sacred Damage converted into Physical Damage
+30.0% Shadow Damage converted into Physical Damage

name: Gods amongst Men
description: Physical, poison and rend damage are increased. You cannot inflict other types of damage.
lore: "The strong dominate the weak. No negotiation, no compromise. The mightiest of warriors deserve the greatest wealth, and we will take it by force." Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. But these nightmarish depictions of violence caught up with fiction when the Ravagers of the Blood Tear stormed the lands of Varg. A terrifying warrior depicted as a whirlwind of iron and gore has risen as their new warlord. In his aura they seem to have reached new depths of savagery: cannibalism, blood rituals, dismemberments... the madness knows no bounds.

name: Feast for the Crows
description: Give all forms of damage Life Leech. Life Leech heals you on the next tick of Health Regeneration.
lore: "We do not sow but we harvest. We join the crows for a feast. Our table is the battlefield!" Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. But these nightmarish depictions of violence caught up with fiction when the Ravagers of the Blood Tear stormed the lands of Varg. A terrifying warrior depicted as a whirlwind of iron and gore has risen as their new warlord. In his aura they seem to have reached new depths of savagery: cannibalism, blood rituals, dismemberments... the madness knows no bounds.

name: Manic Slaughter
description: The more rage you have, the more damage you deal. This applies to all forms of damage.
lore: "No more weapons from the Republic! No more bribes from Varg! Now they die, they all die in an endless requiem of gore and laments! My axe thirsts!" Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. But these nightmarish depictions of violence caught up with fiction when the Ravagers of the Blood Tear stormed the lands of Varg. A terrifying warrior depicted as a whirlwind of iron and gore has risen as their new warlord. In his aura they seem to have reached new depths of savagery: cannibalism, blood rituals, dismemberments... the madness knows no bounds.

modifiers.description: +10% Bleed Chance Score on Rend Damage

name: Blood Reaper
description: A percentage of Physical damage becomes Rend damage.
lore: "Stop running, boy. Your blood goes to waste on the ground." Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. modifiers.description: +30.0% Physical Damage converted into Rend Damage

name: Primordial Insights
description: Ailment stacks applied with critical hits can deal critical damage.
lore: "Most men have even forgotten the existence of Primordials. But I did not. They may have turned silent, but echoes of their lessons are everywhere for those that understand creation." The Augur, Messiah of Illumination _________________________________________________________ The greatest collection of Enneracts known to date is hoarded by a single man: an augur leading the seclusive Cabal of Illumination. Deep into the subterranean city of Salander, he built an academy for his students to train into the manipulations of the precious ancient artefacts. However this augur is a cautious one; he keeps his most powerful Enneracts in a vault at the core of a labyrinth from which only he knows the exit. If his reputation is to be believed, he has learned to master all the spells and secrets that came in his possession.

modifiers.description: Damage over time generated with a Critical Hit deals Critical Damage

name: Insidious Decay
description: When applying ailments, more stacks are applied to the enemy. Other forms of damage are less potent.
lore: "Since I was young, I have felt a constant pressing urgency. As I have grown older, I have realized that death itself is a consequence of inaction. When faced with enemies of great power, cripple them until their inaction finishes them." The Augur, Messiah of Illumination _________________________________________________________ The greatest collection of Enneracts known to date is hoarded by a single man: an augur leading the seclusive Cabal of Illumination. Deep into the subterranean city of Salander, he built an academy for his students to train into the manipulations of the precious ancient artefacts. However this augur is a cautious one; he keeps his most powerful Enneracts in a vault at the core of a labyrinth from which only he knows the exit. If his reputation is to be believed, he has learned to master all the spells and secrets that came in his possession.

modifiers.description: -30.0% Damage that is not Damage Over Time
-15.0% Damage that is not Damage Over Time
-10.0% Damage that is not Damage Over Time

name: Grievous Afflictions
description: Hits can usually only apply one ailment type. Now 2 different ailments can be applied with the same hit.
lore: "They used to be one. As much as they try to be different, they remain bonded by their shared origin. Rare are those who understand that Ice, Lightning and Fire ought to be mastered together." The Augur, Messiah of Illumination _________________________________________________________ The greatest collection of Enneracts known to date is hoarded by a single man: an augur leading the seclusive Cabal of Illumination. Deep into the subterranean city of Salander, he built an academy for his students to train into the manipulations of the precious ancient artefacts. However this augur is a cautious one; he keeps his most powerful Enneracts in a vault at the core of a labyrinth from which only he knows the exit. If his reputation is to be believed, he has learned to master all the spells and secrets that came in his possession.

modifiers.description: -15.0% Damage that is not Damage Over Time

name: Power of the First Men
description: When applying an ailment, there is a chance to double the number of ailment stacks that are applied.
lore: "Pride and stupidity are the mettle of modern men. How dare they think that we are at the peak of our evolution? In fact, that peak happened eons ago! The Enneracts that they use for energy are a painful reminder that we are but an afterthought of our former glory." The Augur, Messiah of Illumination _________________________________________________________ The greatest collection of Enneracts known to date is hoarded by a single man: an augur leading the seclusive Cabal of Illumination. Deep into the subterranean city of Salander, he built an academy for his students to train into the manipulations of the precious ancient artefacts. If his reputation is to be believed, he has learned to master all the spells and secrets that came into his possession.

modifiers.description: +50% Chance to multiply the number of Ailment Stacks applied by +2.0
+25% Chance to multiply the number of Ailment Stacks applied by +0.0
+25% Chance to multiply the number of Ailment Stacks applied by +0.0

name: Immortal Offering
description: Killing an enemy afflicted with ailments gives you a temporary damage boost.
lore: "With the correct ritual, ending a life with witchcraft can transfer the dead's lifeforce to the Fallen whose power was channeled. The Fallen constantly hunger for this energy and will try to convince you to feed them further by offering you great power. My students are trained to resist their temptations, as everyone should be." The Augur, Messiah of Illumination _________________________________________________________ The greatest collection of Enneracts known to date is hoarded by a single man: an augur leading the seclusive Cabal of Illumination. Deep into the subterranean city of Salander, he built an academy for his students to train into the manipulations of the precious ancient artefacts. However this augur is a cautious one; he keeps his most powerful Enneracts in a vault at the core of a labyrinth from which only he knows the exit. If his reputation is to be believed, he has learned to master all the spells and secrets that came in his possession.

modifiers.description: Killing an enemy grants +5.0% Damage for each Ailment Stack on that enemy (up to +5 stacks per damage type)

name: Slipping Shadow
description: Dodge rolls can go through enemies.
lore: "No jade legionnary has ever been interrogated. Our evasive manoeuvers are unparalleled, as for those that do get caught, their will never falter when comes the time of their ultimate sacrifice. The toxin in their hidden tooth is very effective, for death is preferable to failure." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. But for the past fifteen years, the Jade Legion has been harassing caravans with ambushes all over the empire. Their elusive nature has shrouded them in myths concerning their motives and habits. To this day, one of the best kept secrets of the emperor is that the current Jade Legion's leader is an imperial agent working for him. He infiltrated them, assassinated the previous leader and took his place. Now, the emperor puppets the Jade Legion to justify exuberant taxes over all the cities under his dominion.

modifiers.description: Active dodge can go through enemies

name: Blessing of the Jade Legion
description: A percentage of Physical damage becomes Poison damage.
lore: "A thousand poisons for a thousand purposes." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. But for the past fifteen years, the Jade Legion has been harassing caravans with ambushes all over the empire. Their elusive nature has shrouded them in myths concerning their motives and habits. He infiltrated them, assassinated the previous leader and took his place. Now, the emperor puppets the Jade Legion to justify exuberant taxes over all the cities under his dominion.

modifiers.description: +50.0% Physical Damage converted into Toxic Damage

name: Clandestine Execution
description: Deal more damage when only one enemy is nearby.
lore: "Assassination is a peculiar trade. A price for a life, it seems simple on the surface. But the preparation, the circumstances and the execution itself each have their own intricacies. And there can never be any witnesses." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. modifiers.description: +30.0% Damage when only one enemy is within +7.0m range
+5.0% Damage when only one enemy is within +0.0m range
+0.0% Damage when only one enemy is within -3.0m range

name: Phantom Strike
description: Dash attacks are now twice as likely to be critical hits.
lore: "Make your movement unpredictable, for the unseen strike is the deadliest." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. modifiers.description: The Critical Hit Chance of the Dash Attack is doubled

name: Merciless Lethality
description: Critical hits deal more damage, non-critical hits deal less damage.
lore: "If you do not have the intent to kill, do not aim." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. But for the past fifteen years, the Jade Legion has been harassing caravans with ambushes all over the empire. Their elusive nature has shrouded them in myths concerning their motives and habits. To this day, one of the best kept secrets of the emperor is that the current Jade Legion's leader is an imperial agent working for him. He infiltrated them, assassinated the previous leader and took his place. Now, the emperor puppets the Jade Legion to justify exuberant taxes over all the cities under his dominion.

name: Retaliator
description: Each point of physical resistance increases all forms of damage output at the cost of reduced chance to land critical hits.
lore: "The first shield of the Kingless used to tell us: 'Should one of us fall, do not mourn. Do not offer that to your foe. Instead, pick up the shield of the fallen, and bash the skull of your enemy with it.' If my king died, I dare not think of the pain I will unleash on the murderer." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.

modifiers.description: +0.75 Damage per percent of Physical Resistance
+0.25 Damage per percent of Physical Resistance
+0.25 Damage per percent of Physical Resistance

name: Selfless Courage
description: Blocking a hit provides you and your allies increased defenses.
lore: "The Kingless are supposed to protect Laibon. Yet, criminality runs amok throughout the kingdom, and the Kingless refuse to intervene. I would rather die searching for a dead man than waste my life following hollow principles." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.

modifiers.description: +20% All Resistances for you and your allies after blocking a hit

name: Kingless Aegis
description: Gain block chance no matter what weapon is being used.
lore: "The heart of my king still beats, I can feel its drumming deep in my bones like a call to action. I cannot rest until he is safe, and thus, my journey begins." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.

modifiers.description: +10.0 Added Block Chance and allow any weapon to block
+5.0 Added Block Chance and allow any weapon to block

name: Sacred Oath
description: Blocking an enemy's attack applies Weakness, makes that enemy weaker and more vulnerable.
lore: "Our ruler is a man-god, a beacon of light gifted with secrets of creation! His lineage kept our realm safe from the long night for centuries... but now that he disappeared with no descendants, we can only fear the worse for our lands." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.

name: Blessed Manna
description: Health globes will now offer increased resistances for a short time as well as heal you.
lore: "The bounty of our holy ruler was limitless. No-one went hungry and the silos were full. When his divine inspiration departed, so too did our resources. Now that we are at our most desperate, it's a small miracle that we survive at all." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.

modifiers.description: +40% All Resistances for you and your allies after picking up a health globe

name: Duty to Exterminate
description: Increased maximum Rage and Willpower, allowing you to cast more spells and attack skills.
lore: "Gomora is overrun with cultists; filthy, scheming rodents who exist solely to do harm unto others. However, with so many of them in one place, killing them becomes sport." Kardis, The Blackstaff _________________________________________________________ There's a city cursed with a unique ecosystem. Far away from busy civilizations, Gomora welcomes every and any cult on its island indiscriminately, no matter how evil and insidious. Powerful Arbiters keep most of the madness in check. But still, repeated bloodsheds in the darkest corners of this twisted city has created the space for a vigilante to rise. She is known as the Blackstaff of Gomora, a warlock as devious as the evil she is fighting. She mastered witchcraft and became a faith leech, which might explain why the cultists dread her so much.

name: Residual Energy
description: Casting an spell empowers your next attacks with additional damage of the spell's type for a short period of time.
lore: "Magic is unpredictable. Taking the energy of a Fallen is imprecise and it can escape your body unexpectedly. Weaker cultists often struggle with this; they bite off more they can chew and are consumed by their own magic." Kardis, The Blackstaff _________________________________________________________ There's a city cursed with a unique ecosystem. Far away from busy civilizations, Gomora welcomes every and any cult on its island indiscriminately, no matter how evil and insidious. Powerful Arbiters keep most of the madness in check. But still, repeated bloodsheds in the darkest corners of this twisted city has created the space for a vigilante to rise. She is known as the Blackstaff of Gomora, a warlock as devious as the evil she is fighting. She mastered witchcraft and became a faith leech, which might explain why the cultists dread her so much.

modifiers.description: Attacks gain +30.0% damage from the last spell cast. The type of damage is the same as the spell's damage

name: Reining In the Darkness
description: Spells are more likely to deal critical damage when above a certain threshold of Willpower.
lore: "Be careful, they say. Be careful, for when you gaze into the abyss, it gazes right back at you. The line sometimes gets blurred: am I surrounded by darkness? Or am I the darkness?" Kardis, The Blackstaff _________________________________________________________ There's a city cursed with a unique ecosystem. Far away from busy civilizations, Gomora welcomes every and any cult on its island indiscriminately, no matter how evil and insidious. Powerful Arbiters keep most of the madness in check. She is known as the Blackstaff of Gomora, a warlock as devious as the evil she is fighting. She mastered witchcraft and became a faith leech, which might explain why the cultists dread her so much.

modifiers.description: +100% Spells Critical Hit Chance Score while willpower is above ?

name: Resilience to Corruption
description: When you are afflicted with damage over time, ailment damage affects your Force Shield before your Health.
lore: "Morality will get you killed in Gomora. No-one is "good", there is only power. Here, you are measured by the strength of your conviction alone." Kardis, The Blackstaff _________________________________________________________ There's a city cursed with a unique ecosystem. Far away from busy civilizations, Gomora welcomes every and any cult on its island indiscriminately, no matter how evil and insidious. Powerful Arbiters keep most of the madness in check. She is known as the Blackstaff of Gomora, a warlock as devious as the evil she is fighting. She mastered witchcraft and became a faith leech, which might explain why the cultists dread her so much.

modifiers.description: Damage Over Time is dealt to your Force Shield before your Health

name: Faith Leech
description: Dealing damage will now allow you to recover Force Shield instead of Health with Life Leech.
lore: "When these mongrels are cut off from the power of their master, their world is turned upside down. Alone, powerless, frightened. But unlike orphans, they deserve no mercy. None at all."
